content.description: Climb the bolted line with several bulges that is 15 feet to the right of the attached pillar.   The start is a bit dirty.  The crux section is near the small pine tree that is growing out of the crack.
content.location: 15 feet to the right of the attached pillar

content.description: Large Broken up wall just east of Big Chief Wall. Route begins about sixty feet left of the landmark large attached pillar. Quick easy scrabble up to the belay ledge. About 8 feet above you will begin to see the bolt line. Difficult to find the bolt line for the ground. Bolt line follows up the water groove. .
content.protection: 14 bolts. Double anchors with a two rope single rap.
content.location: Quick easy scrabble up to the belay ledge. About 8 feet above you will begin to see the bolt line. Difficult to find the bolt line for the ground. Bolt line follows up the water groove. .

content.description: Climb the low-angled 5.5 section past multiple horizontals to gain the first bolt. 40' off the ground. Follow the bolt line up the distinct bulges
content.protection: 0.3 - 0.75 Nuts, Smaller Cams in horizontal, 9 bolts
content.location: Start 10 feet let of the large attached pillar.

content.description: Climb the left-facing dihedral created by the large attached pillar. From the top of the pillar climb the micro seams and horizontals past some bolts and to the anchors.
content.protection: Yellow C3 - #3, Nuts, Micro Nuts, 4 Bolts.
content.location: 10 Feet to the east of Burlington Bulges. Route starts on the left side of the large Pillar.

content.description: This discontinuous, broken wall is about 750' E of The Big Chief. All routes are accessible for TR and all routes face S
